title: grammar proportions
content: Hey, I was wondering if there are some ‘standard’ proportions dealing with the sizes of grammatical characters and the rest of the alphabet? Any rules of thumb?
author: Sacha

comments.content: Sorry: the term “grammatical characters” does not compute. Do these characters have another name?

does analphabetic characters help? virgules, semi-colons, periods, brackets, paranthesis . . . all of them.

Thanks for the link, Dan.

_does analphabetic characters help? virgules, semi-colons, periods, brackets, paranthesis … all of them._

It helps immensely…”punctuation” works, too.

Is there a good reason to get so bitter about terminology-naming errors?
